Name: sparse_autoencoder_scaling
Title: Scaling Laws and Evaluation Methods for Sparse Autoencoders in Language Models
Experiment:
The paper presents several key implementations and experiments:
1. A k-sparse autoencoder architecture using TopK activation function replacing traditional L1 penalty
2. Auxiliary loss (AuxK) and initialization techniques to prevent dead latents
3. Training methodology scaled up to 16M latent dimensions on GPT-4
4. Multiple evaluation metrics including:
   - Downstream loss
   - Feature probe recovery
   - N2G explanations for interpretability
   - Ablation sparsity measures
5. Systematic study of scaling relationships between:
   - Number of latents (n)
   - Sparsity level (k)
   - Model size
   - Compute budget
6. Analysis of progressive feature recovery and activation patterns

Name: hierarchical_sparse_autoencoder
Title: Hierarchical Sparse Autoencoders for Multi-Level Interpretable Feature Extraction
Experiment:
Implementation steps:
1. Implement two-level sparse autoencoder architecture:
   - Level 1: High-dimensional, low sparsity for basic features
   - Level 2: Lower-dimensional, higher sparsity for abstract features
2. Add residual connections between levels
3. Design loss function with three components:
   - Reconstruction loss for each level
   - Contrastive loss between levels to encourage separation
   - Sparsity constraints (different k per level)
4. Implement curriculum training:
   - Train Level 1 to convergence
   - Freeze Level 1 and train Level 2
5. Evaluate using:
   - Feature-level mutual information
   - Inter-level feature overlap metrics
   - Level-specific probing tasks
   - Causal intervention studies
6. Compare against baseline single-level autoencoder
7. Analyze feature hierarchy through case studies
